page.title: 06Interview with Cllr. R. Hall
page.content:
Mr.Ron Hall has been a councillor in Redcar since 1949. He has seen Redcar change over the years. At one time Redcar had its own council and in 1968 Redcar became part of Teesside. Mr. Hall was elected Mayor in 1971.
In 1974 Redcar became part of Cleveland. Mr. Hall was asked whether Redcar was a better place to live in when it had its own council. Mr. Hall thought that Redcar was better when it had its own council because all the rates collected in Redcar were spent on Redcar alone. When it became part of a bigger council, money had to be spent over a larger area and therefore Redcar didn't get as much attention. Mr. Hall also felt that he had more personal contact with the people of Redcar in the past.
